thread.title: Sydney lonely heart fraudster jailed for 3.5 years
thread.title_full: Sydney lonely heart fraudster jailed for 3.5 years

title: Sydney lonely heart fraudster jailed for 3.5 years
text:
Sydney lonely heart fraudster jailed for 3.5 years By 9NEWS Sanaa Derbas in 2016 pleaded guilty to 11 fraud-related offences after tricking seven victims into lending her money. 
A Sydney mother-of-four who swindled about $2 million from lonely men on dating services has been sentenced to three-and-a-half years in jail. 
Sanaa Derbas in 2016 pleaded guilty to 11 fraud-related offences after tricking seven victims into lending her money, purportedly for hotel rooms, funerals for dead relatives and her mortgage. 
In reality, the money was spent by the 41-year-old on gambling, cocaine use and a new home. 
At Sydney's Downing Centre District Court this afternoon, Judge Paul Conlon sentenced Derbas to three-and-a-half years in jail with a non-parole period of 18 months, noting the "calculated cunning and guile" involved in her offending. 
Derbas met many of her victims through dating services before telling them a series of lies to extract money from them. 
"I love you, can't wait to be with you. I haven't eaten since yesterday," she told one victim in a text message. 
"My pension here 2 day can spare 100 for yr tucker. Loving U as ever X," he replied. 
One 69-year-old man gave Derbas $1.7 million, initially to help her pay her mortgage in 2008. 
When he asked to be repaid, she said she could not because her son had died of swine flu. 
She took more than $180,000 from another victim after asking for help covering the funeral expenses of her dead daughter. 
She also told most of her seven victims her mother had died, in spite of the fact she was alive and well and living down the street from her. 
When police searched her home in the western Sydney suburb of Miller, they found 15 phones as well as an address book containing the names of 349 men. Â© Nine Digital Pty Ltd 2017
